website_summaries.verdict: The best budget set of blind spot mirrors that offers a simple setup and installation process.
pros: Comes in a round and rectangular shape to match the size/shape of the side mirrors
Available in 2 or 4 piece packs for a better value purchase
cons: The adhesive backing is prone to coming loose in wet weather or humid conditions

customer_reviews.title: Best of all the blind spot mirrors I've tried.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one because there is no bezel that takes up space when the rear view mirror is already so small and you'll need whatever space you can get. The angle is also adjustable. Of all the ones I've purchased, this seemed to fit and look the best.
customer_reviews.author: LiterOfPeter

customer_reviews.title: Office/Cubicle Mirror
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the most worthy purchases I have ever made. It works perfectly as a "rearview mirror" while sitting at my desk at work not doing what I should be doing. If your boss or coworkers have a habit of ninja-ing behind you when you're trying to shop on amazon, google bears doing cool shi*, or looking at houses etc. you should invest in this so you can be ready to pull up a spreadsheet and make it look like you are really dedicated to work.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Good mirror
customer_reviews.text: I actually got this mirror to affix to my monitor at work since I hate not knowing what's going on behind me. It's a good size for the corner of my monitor and the wide angle gives me a perfect view of what's going on behind me in all directions. Maybe not it's intended use but it's good for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Merrin

customer_reviews.title: The angle on the glass is too great and objects that are only a few feet away ...
customer_reviews.text: The angle on the glass is too great and objects that are only a few feet away are difficult to make out . The passenger side application is even worse, since this mirror sits roughly a half inch off the surface of your mirror, objects are microscopic and takes my eyes off the road too long to try and figure out what is in the tiny mirror.. It is difficult to angle it just right . And if you're like me, I wash my car often and the mirror moves making it a hassle to have to angle it just right again. Im sorry I don't have the patients to fool with this item.
customer_reviews.author: RAY

customer_reviews.title: These blind spot mirrors are super helpful with parallel parking
customer_reviews.text: These blind spot mirrors are super helpful with parallel parking, blindspots and seeing if you are in between the lines of the space you parked in. Love them
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Allen

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This product is a piece of crap. I applied it to my car and let it sit for about 18 hours. I started driving on my way to work and it flew off and hit a car behind me. This items a law suit waiting to happen...
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: CANNOT WITHSTAND 87°
customer_reviews.text: Im so mad! I bought 2 packs for 2 different cars.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Great flat mount mirror
customer_reviews.text: Great flat flush mount (see picture) mirror option. I have put these types of mirrors on all of my vehicles since 2001. These are the nicest I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Blake S. Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Better adhesive needed
customer_reviews.text: These are great, but I wish they had come with better/stronger adhesive on the mirror part. One of the mirrors popped off in the car wash a week after I installed it, but the swivel mount is still there. I plan to buy another little mirror and stick it to the mounting, but the adhesive on the mirror doesn’t cover enough surface area to make a really strong bond. Other than that, these are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Marielle

customer_reviews.title: the mirrors easily fall off and you are left with the black ...
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy! Have had two sets....the mirrors easily fall off and you are left with the black attachment piece stuck to your mirror. It, however, is a real pain to get off. Never would buy again, Never would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Poor adhesion, especially if you’ll drive in winter.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these and installed them a week after I got them. Cleaned the mirror and waited for it dry. I then wiped the area with an alcohol wipe and left it for 20 minutes to dry. I did the same for the plastic mirror mount. lol and behold, a month later the first solid freeze we got overnight, the convex mirror disappeared. It obviously came lose as I was driving. That’s crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Stormy

customer_reviews.title: Very dangerous
customer_reviews.text: What are these people talking about? A mirror, that needs to be accessed within a split second, cannot MOVE. It’s very dangerous because you get in your car and if it’s moved a fraction you won’t know until you’re nearly hitting someone on your blind spot because your mirror has moved.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Davis

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WELL!
customer_reviews.text: This blind spot mirror is being used on our 2016 Toyota Highlander on the drivers outside mirror. Easy to install, just make sure the area where you attach the mirror is clean. It does rotate but actually only one position works best. This is not a high quality product but works well enough considering the price. Have been using it for several weeks now. The view of oncoming blind spot traffic is smallish, but this mirror is smallish. Toyota should build blind spot mirrors into the driver side outside mirror but they don't. Overall high recomended and used daily.
customer_reviews.author: Terry E. Tibbetts

customer_reviews.title: Fell off soon after!
customer_reviews.text: First the passenger blind spot mirror fell off and then the drivers blind spot mirror fell off. Now I have two ugly glue residue stains on my mirrors which looks terrible and I have no blind spot mirrors. And yes, I did put them on true to the instructions. Don't waste your money. NOT recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute little mirrors but bad investment overall
customer_reviews.text: Installed the blindspot mirrors today on my SUV and it was a breeze. Its instantly improved view/blindspot. Fingers crossed it lives up to expectations and I can have the same review months from now! Update: Unfortunately one of the mirrors came off as soon as I got a car wash. I waited several weeks before washing in hopes it would give the mirror’s adhesive more time to set. Now purchasing a new set of mirrors from a different vendor. Waste of money if you plan on getting car washes.
customer_reviews.author: Asha881

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, but Cheap Quality
customer_reviews.text: The mirrors worked quite well on my 08 Ninja 650r... until they both broke off. The plastic mount, especially the ball that goes in the socket, is cheap quality and does not stand up to the vibrations and motions of your typical motorcycle. One side snapped off (leaving only the adhesive mount attached) when I put the front end down after a small wheelie. The other side began to lose its ability to stay in the adjusted position (would slowly move towards the outside no matter which way I positioned it), and eventually snapped off as well. They only lasted about 1000 miles. The mirrors were very nice to have while they lasted, though.
customer_reviews.author: Easton Pal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Makes backing up and passing cars easier and safer. I have people ask me all of the time where I got them. Super easy to put on and have been secure for two years now. Even I'm car washes. Negative 20 winters. Super humid summers. Have yet to have an issue. They are fully adjustable even after sticking them. Can be adjusted to suit your view.
customer_reviews.author: CoreyB

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to see the cars with fish eye effect
customer_reviews.text: I can't stand the fish eye effect that most of these blind spot mirrors have. During the day, it's difficult to distinguish which car is in the lane next to yours, and at night it's impossible. I realized that there's also a major flaw with all blind spot mirrors: the right mirror on all cars are magnified, and so should 1 of the blind spot mirrors. There's an as seen on TV blind spot mirror that's slightly bigger and it has no fish eye effect and it's so much easier to see the cars with it.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud89

customer_reviews.title: Super Simple
customer_reviews.text: I got a newer car and couldn't get the same Euro-style split-angle mirrors that my old one had, so I had to find a set of stick-ons. My first set was a swiveling rectangular set but I couldn't see much and one fell off the swivel, so I realized I had to simplify more. I got these, and just attached them directly to the mirror (without the swivel) at the top outside position. You can use the outer ring of adhesive to do this. I like the frameless look and I can see clearly into my blind spots. They're great.
customer_reviews.author: StSky

customer_reviews.title: Very good mirror
customer_reviews.text: Very good mirror for your car. It doesn't take a lot of space but big enough to see your blind spot. This mirror has no borders around it, which is important. It allows it to blend in with your own mirrors. Allows for all around adjustments to suit your preferences. Highly recommended, but make sure the adhesive sticks to the mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: Hien Ho

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. After Reading other reviews about the tendency for ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. After Reading other reviews about the tendency for the mirror to fall off in time I decided to glue the convex mirror to the bracket then use the peel and stick to place on my car mirror. One aspect I would change...with the mirror in place you can see the reflection of the back of the mirror and it is white and a little distracting. I wish they the tape black. Update: like many other reviewers after just 3 months one of the mirrors (not the bracket) has fallen off...great idea but if it only last a couple of months really just a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Here in Northern VA

customer_reviews.title: Installed these 2 years ago and so glad I did.
customer_reviews.text: My new-used 2004 van did not have blind spot mirrors. My previous 2004 van had them installed after-market. I search for a long time to find a mirror this small (so it does not take up too much regular mirror) and no wide aluminum frame. I just wanted a mirror, not a chunk of aluminum. I'd recommend these for any older vehicle. BTW, a friend at work has one of these on his computer screen so that when somebody approaches his work cubicle he sees them before they introduce themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Z22ZINFS

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy. I see a lot of people however putting ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple and easy. I see a lot of people however putting them on the "inside" of the side mirror for abnormal car. Meaning on your driver side you want it to be all the way to the left of the mirror as pictured, passenger all the way to the right. Also good to mention you don't have to have the "swivel" you can choose to just stick the mirrors right onto your mirror as I did (3m double side tape already applied ready to peel and apply).
customer_reviews.author: Emod

customer_reviews.title: I recommend the stationary ones or round ones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my car and my sons car. Pro: easy to install. Con: they move to easy, and I had to readjust them several times in ONE DAY. they don’t have the visual extension range I wanted. I ended up buying the stationary round ones insread
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Zero issues over 5 months
customer_reviews.text: Don't be skeptical when purchasing these mirrors, I've put them through the carwash, driving in single-digit temps, and driving in 80 weather. These blindspot mirrors are still sticking great to the side mirror. If you do a lot of driving, especially on highways/interstates, I recommend grabbing these; they help out tremendously when you can't turn your head completely around to check the blindspot.
customer_reviews.author: Knuckles89

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirror! I placed this pair of blind spot ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Mirror! I placed this pair of blind spot mirror on both bottom-left corner of each side mirror. I was somewhat skeptical when I was trying it at night and see if I was able to actually see the cars on my blind spot. After a year of having my first old blind spot mirrors, it went yellow and I cannot see anymore that I bought in a dollar store. I took the chance to replace this with this pair of blind spot mirrors, and it turned out really well. It is clear at night and having it bigger helped me to see. Will recommend this to my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Justin C

customer_reviews.title: Great Blindspot Mirrors - BUT With Room for Improvement
customer_reviews.text: These two small mirrors are the easiest to set for blind spot viewing & accuracy I’ve ever owned. That said, one fell off within two weeks, so I ordered another set. No adhesion issues this time. These mirrors do have one glaring fault IMO. They are in need of a frame around them so that every time you go thru a car wash or otherwise remove moisture from your mirrors, you don’t have to readjust them. Without some sort of protective ring around them, they are moved by the slightest touch.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Reno

customer_reviews.title: The best you can imagine to buy I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this blind spot mirrors for more than a year maybe two, is a high quality glass I can’t imagine how is driving without them I’m so use to them that are probably the only ones I take a look whenever I’ll turn ,they have never taken off , never gets foggy, And I love them cause have save me from many many accidents till the date Buy them are so cheap but you’ll never regret it
customer_reviews.author: Nathaly

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install, great visibility
customer_reviews.text: I have a Chevy Suburban 2002 Z71 - still going strong that I put these on. It only takes a minute to get these into place. I put mine at the top outside corner of the mirrors and they work great. I didn't even realize I stopped the head swirling around to make sure no one is in my blind spot when i'm changing lanes especially when towing a trailer. I change lanes all the time now with confidence. These give great visibility - no more blind spots
customer_reviews.author: John Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable angle
customer_reviews.text: Great blind spot mirror for such a cheap price. Most of the blind spot mirrors in the market are not adjustable, so you have to be very careful when you install them, if you don't install them at the perfect angle, you can't see the blind spot properly. But this mirror is adjustable after installation, so it does not matter how you install them you can always adjust them to get the perfect view. Just be careful when you wash the mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: C Roy

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Blindside mirrors are always useful, since they allow you to see additional angles. One thing that I find them really useful for is parking. Checking if your tires are inside the line, how far you are from the curb, etc etc. These are easy to apply, and the adhesive seems to hold up. A nice bonus is that the mirrors can be rotated. It's been a few months now, and no problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and great value
customer_reviews.text: I have a Dodge Magnum with a horrible blind spot. Ordered this hoping for a little more vision on the driver’s side. The mirror was very easy to install, just follow the instructions. The adhesive in VERY strong, so make sure the mirror is exactly where you want it before you stick it on. A bonus I wasn’t expecting was that the mirror is adjustable. I’m super happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these blind spot mirrors
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these blind spot mirrors. So much. Like I don't even know how I drove before them...I depend on them so much now! The ONLY thing is that they break easily. I accidentally dropped one the other day, VERY close to the ground, and it shattered. I know, it's glass. But, come on. I also went through a car wash with my mirrors folded in and one of them got ripped off in the car wash. Other than that, I will be buying more of these if any other issues occur with my current ones because I love them so much!
customer_reviews.author: Summer Liston

customer_reviews.title: 1 fell off but I still love them!
customer_reviews.text: These are great. One fell off instantly so now I only have one, but it’s so handy I still give it 4 stars- 5 if it didn’t fall off. These are better than a blind spot monitor, because you can see it for yourself. There’s no more worrying that you can or can’t merge, you now know with 100 % certainty if it’s safe. The one that lasts has held on through multiple car washes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a little small but they work
customer_reviews.text: These are small, but they work well. I didn't use the mount to swivel it, just placed it in the lower outside corner of the mirror. They work great in the daytime, nighttime not as good. I wanted a basic blind spot mirror for cheap and I think for the price these are adequate. Not the best, but suitable. Improved over my mirror without them, but if they were about a half inch more in diameter I think they would be ideal.
customer_reviews.author: captmarc

customer_reviews.title: Not stable, prone to moving after installs.
customer_reviews.text: The pivot gap .. between your original mirror and this wide angle mirror is too much for comfort. With a slight touch, the mirror is set to dislocate and you will have to adjust it again. I would buy something that sticks closer to my original mirror so that there is minimum movement after I install it.
customer_reviews.author: Prateek

customer_reviews.title: Not suited for a hot garage
customer_reviews.text: These were fine mirrors, not great, just fine, during the cooler months. However, now that it has become warm in Kansas, our garage gets even hotter (85+ degrees F) and the adhesive doesn't hold in the heat. I just had a mirror fall off while my truck was sitting in the garage and the mirror is now broke. Not only do I now have a broken mirror but I also have 7 years of bad luck coming my way. Just something to keep in mind if you live in an area where it gets hot in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: David Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: and once dried it's holing up great. It went through some winter and spring rainy ...
customer_reviews.text: Found these cheaper at a retail store. For what it is, you'll find a lot of these being sold by different sellers, but it's essentially the same product. I can't speak to whether or not the 3M stickers are rated for exterior applications, but mine came off after 2 months. They sent me a replacement after they needed a photo to verify it. It took a month for it to arrive. Can't really complain. For the replacement, I stripped off the foam and tape on the mirror's underside, applied waterproof automotive glue, and once dried it's holing up great. It went through some winter and spring rainy days and doesn't look like it will fall off. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: The clarity of the mirror is great. The plastic base in thin.
customer_reviews.text: The ability to adjust the mirror angle is great. The passenger side went on without issue and is focused right where the blind spot was. The driver side mirror installation did not go as well. When attaching the base to the mirror, the base broke. I checked the plastic base and found it was quite brittle and would expect others to have similar issues. I did install the mirror on the driver side without the base and it works perfectly and aim/focus is right where it needs to be. I will stick with this installation.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Five stars
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this item approximately three times now and I will continue to buy it for any vehicle I have. Installation is very easy, granted you follow the simple instructions. Mirrors are very clear. Very easy to manipulate and definitely helps when merging/changing lanes. Of course, you should always check your blind spots regardless by physically turning around.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Can’t see out of my rear truck window due to 3 layers of glass (truck window plus front and rear windows of camper shell/topper/canopy), 2 of which are heavily tinted. All of which are dirty most of the time. Bought 2 of these mirrors and they work well. Now I can use my side mirrors as rear views and still see into my blind spots. Much safer this way. Can merge safely even with no visibility out of my main rear view mirror.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: Needing to replace a 10+ year old set of blind spot mirrors for my 4Runner, I was hoping to find a pair that would at a minimum perform as well as the originals they're meant to replace. The glass on the older mirrors had become hazy; that's something I'm hoping doesn't happen to these. I prefer the added adjustability of these Ampper mirrors as well. As far as rigidity, stability and overall functionality goes; so far, good.
customer_reviews.author: ChipperTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Does it’s job well. I have no blind spots in my side mirrors anymore. I got into an accident and had some close encounters due to my blind spots, so this has been a great help to calm those anxieties. Everyone should have these! It’s still sticking, and it’s gone through the hot and humid summer here in the south as well as hurricane weather.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Varela

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: Product is very easy to use. Placement is a matter of preference for the owner but it does install easily. In limited use since installation it functions as designed or described.
customer_reviews.author: FeelingGood

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service and mirrors are fine
customer_reviews.text: One of the mirror was scratched and I realized that after sticking it to my rear view mirror. Now can't even return it without breaking the mirror itself or my rear view mirror. Will never buy again. Updated: March 2017 - I was contacted by the seller and they agreed to send me replacement mirrors. Was happy to see good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav

customer_reviews.title: This mirrors are awesome please read if you have eye sight issues.
customer_reviews.text: Hello amazon shoppers, I've been using them for a few month and gotta tell you. It's awesome and helps me do my turn safely. But, be mindful if you have any sight issues at night they can be challenging. As an advice look at both mirror the small one and big one before turning. If you find my review helpful please support/like it. It will help me knowing that I help some one out :)
customer_reviews.author: Al J Martinez

customer_reviews.title: How much is your safety worth to you?
customer_reviews.text: BUY THESE! No matter how great a driver you are or how far you can twist your head around to check your blind spot, there will always be some character on the road who will pull a dumb stunt. These give you a distinct advantage when changing lanes. They saved me from an accident the very afternoon I put them on the car. Well worth the cost and effort.
customer_reviews.author: Lovestoast!

customer_reviews.title: Almost love it
customer_reviews.text: I really love how these frameless mirrors look and work. As mentioned before, I removed 1 star because of the highly noticeable white 3M sticker on the back of the mirror which is reflected in the side mirror. I should have colored it with a black marker or placed black material around it before installation but now it's too late. Sometimes you don't notice the 3M sticker but most of the time you do, making that desired seamless not seamless at all. Can't they find black 3M adhesive or better yet, can they avoid that sticker in the outer area altogether?
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: great if not planning to go through car wash ever
customer_reviews.text: works great so far. I haven’t tried to go through the car wash with it yet. According to the description, un- then re- installment is needed if care wash. Sounds complicated and it doesn’t come with any additional adherence arrangements. My hold back for the 5 star is: am I supposed not to go through the car wash with these at all?
customer_reviews.author: LiveSimple

customer_reviews.title: Bye Bye Blind Spot!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Product!!!! One of the best purchases I have made for my vehicle. If you follow the instructions to the T, the product does what it says. I have an excellent view of my blind spot from the drivers side. It matches perfectly well with my excellent Honda Lane watch for the passenger side. The mirror is very adjustable and it stays in place when set. The only slight problem I have is when it rains or it catches a certain spot of the suns glare, it makes it a little more difficult to see out of it. Other than that, this is a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear mirrors and it sticks well.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality glass mirrors. The pivot arms feels sturdy and holds its position well. The double sided foam tape are made by 3M and sticks well with proper prep. Only drawback is that it ships in a bubble envelope, and because it's glass, they are prone to breakage. Mine came with 1 broken mirror, but was quickly replaced by AMAZON the following day.
customer_reviews.author: Roadtrekker

customer_reviews.title: Safer Driving!
customer_reviews.text: Darn those blind spots in my Camry and Tundra! After almost nailing some other cars changing the 6 Lanes we have here in SoCal I decided to purchase these small mirrors! Talk about a life changer! These little disks have made my driving in crazy traffic much more confident! Also helped with keeping the white linning motorcycles in view so I don't wipe them out changing lanes. I think all vehicles should be required to have these. Ended up buying them for all 4 of my kids vehicles too. Get them!
customer_reviews.author: Cwboyz235

customer_reviews.title: Not Fisheye enough
customer_reviews.text: This item is not fish eyed enough. If it were, there would be no need for the pivot system, which can be easily knocked out of place. With this item you cannot see your whole blind spot without adjusting the mirrors, and when adjusted properly you still can't see the ground making them useless for parking. I bought a vehicle with ones that are much better fisheyed and are flat against the car mirror, and it's great for parking even lifted vehicles. I bought these for my little brother because he is new to driving and these and they are so flat they're useless
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Daum

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price
customer_reviews.text: I really like these but I do not like how the 3m tape on the back is larger than the mount. Every time I look into my mirror I can see the unused tape and now its starting to peel off... LOL. I know thats crazy but I think they use this mirror for another product as well. Otherwise its pretty good. Honestly the swivel part seems too loose and gets bumped off line easily but for the price, its great.
customer_reviews.author: Cloggedart

customer_reviews.title: NOT STIFF, They MOVE constantly
customer_reviews.text: If you wash your car a lot, if you pull in your mirrors to park or on the street, these SUCK. If you NEVER wash your mirrors and NEVER touch your mirrors... then maybe. They have a mount piece then a ball joint that allows you to get them to the perfect angle... But they move easy, i'm always having to adjust them, daily, and when you wash your car... they move. Wish I could return and get others, so for now, until they break, i superglued them SOLID. But now there's leverage, so if you touch them... they pop off.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Consider Me A Fan
customer_reviews.text: I know that some folks here have had trouble with these mirrors being knocked off by carwashes, but I've gone through several carwashes since installing them, and while they need to be readjusted afterwards, they have stayed in place. Tremendous help with driving, and superior to factory wide angle lenses in that they are adjustable. My blind spots are GONE!
customer_reviews.author: danarama

customer_reviews.title: Purchased a year and a half ago.  No complaints
customer_reviews.text: What I really like about these mirrors are the fact that they are glass. I have had them on my car now for 1 1/2 years. They have not fallen off and there are not pitting as some have in the past. I run my car through a car wash at least once a week and have not had any problems. I did not use the swivel mount when I mounted them and recommend that they be mounted without it.
customer_reviews.author: FltRN

customer_reviews.title: Great for your desk but not for car.
customer_reviews.text: I use at my cubicle at work since my desk faces away from the cubicle opening so I can se when someone comes in so the don’t make me jump. For that it worked great because you can angle it any way you want. But I can’t imagine it would be good for a cars side view mirror. Once you get it where you want it would easily move from wind, a bump, and especially a car wash.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Blindspot mirrors
customer_reviews.text: Apparently I didn’t understand it right the first time and I had to buy a second set of mirrors. They’re nicer than most because you can adjust them after you have stuck them to the other mirror. I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: There's just nothing bad about them!
customer_reviews.text: These are so helpful! I've had them up on my car mirrors for a few months now and they have been really good for my driving practice with a new car. I love how I can see so much more and not feel as nervous backing into spaces and so on! There are really no downsides to this item, I wonder why more people don't have it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Prisca Lo Surdo

customer_reviews.title: The rim-less mirrors look nice. I bought the 4-mirror set and picked the ...
customer_reviews.text: The rim-less mirrors look nice. I bought the 4-mirror set and picked the best two for installation (saved the other ones in case any fell off). I did not use the swivel/rotate piece, I stuck the round mirror directly onto the side-view mirror. No issues with it falling off or going through car washes. It has been 1 month so far.
customer_reviews.author: AN

customer_reviews.title: Piece if UNK
customer_reviews.text: Small rim of adhesive that is to affix micro to small round optic is worthless. t sadly covers the piece's surface area. I installed it as instructed and it fell off within 10 miles of driving. And, not I have to take the darn thing to UPS to return it....I'll spend more time on gas and time than the plastic piece of junk is worth. Who ever said it works, is probably paid by the company.
customer_reviews.author: Karl F. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: The mirrors are not great quality and because they are moveable
customer_reviews.text: The mirrors are not great quality and because they are moveable, they will randomly move while you're driving if you hit bumps or whatever. I would not recommend these mirrors and would urge anyone to consider these instead, they are AMAZING and are the only blind spot mirrors I will ever buy from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Stefenie & Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: These are very small, so the image is very small. But with practice I can catch cars in the blind spot effectively. They are easily adjustable so when washing the mirror one must be careful not to knock it out of alignment. Once positioned well (centered on the next lane over), they are very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Makes you a safer driver.
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. My brother in law got struck by a car on his motorcycle because the driver didn’t see him in his blind spot. Luckily he is okay, but I bought these things shortly after to make sure I’m a more safe cautious driver for the people around me. Another bright side it makes it easier to park Right mirror is a little small. Wish it was magnified a little bit. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon shade

customer_reviews.title: Little safety mirrors
customer_reviews.text: This product was nicely packaged and protected from scratches . Installation was straight forward and I did not run into any problems. The only weird thing is that Only the center portion of the 3m tape is used to adhere the black plastic pivot with the remainder of the 3m tape left on the back of the mirror. Hope this extra tape is not a problem down the road. All in all, happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: 93minpin

customer_reviews.title: Unique, useful, and resistant
customer_reviews.text: Amazing mirrors! First time I ever use blind spot mirrors. I actually only got these as a way to assist my car when I parallel park, I drive a Dodge Challenger and it’s very difficult to see curbs when they’re right next to your sides and as such it makes it very easy to curb your rims. I use these and the ability to adjust the mirrors is a god send! Normal blind spot mirrors will only help with just that, your blind spot. Which honestly isn’t really necessary if you set up your side mirrors properly. But to each their own, the fact that these mirrors are adjustable really let you customize them to suit your needs and vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Might work for you but not me.
customer_reviews.text: I was anticipating the 3M adhesive to be on the back of the mirror it’s self as it showed in all the photos. Because I wanted to flush mount the mirror. Unfortunately as you see in the photo it does not have the masking directly on the back of the mirror. But if you’re looking to mount it has an adjustable angle it looks like good quality very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Syncere Harris

customer_reviews.title: Well made, work nicely
customer_reviews.text: These little mirrors really help. My car has some big blind spots to the rear. I never felt like I could really be all that sure the lane next to me was clear for merging into, even after looking back twice. I feel a lot better being able to check by looking over my shoulder, checking the mirrors that came with the car and now having these little mirrors to fill in the information gaps.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: mixed bag
customer_reviews.text: The reflective surface is good and they are adjustable - that's about it for the good part. My main concern is with the 3M tape - mine fell of in 6 months. Sure, I can re-apply some new tape, but I never had to do that with other mirrors we used on our cars. Also the rounded shape is less practical - but you have to try it to make your mind on that.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Not the best adhesive
customer_reviews.text: I lost one of the mirrors I stuck to my car. Others are blaming 85 degree + heat as making the adhesive melt. I know it says right in the title but 2" isnt big enough for how convex the lens for this is. Vehicles right next to you appear quite small which requires you to focus in on the mirror for a potentially unsafe amount of time. I found myself popping both mounts off and scrubbing the mirrors with goo gone. Oh well, I'll try another brand again someday.
customer_reviews.author: J. F.

customer_reviews.title: Easily stolen
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of these. They might a good idea but I will never know because the mirrors disappear off my mirrors within days (just the mirrors not the mounts !) Apparently some makeup obsessed individual just has to have these mirrors. DOn't know why as they are concave and don't easily reflect a human face.
customer_reviews.author: Janet L. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Good for Cubical Dwellers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this 4 pack to use as cubical rear view mirrors. Our office was recently relocated and we came to need these. I like them very much as do the co-workers I have the others to. The image is clear and a nice wide-angle. The adhesive seems strong, and the pivot very useful for positioning the mirrors when affixed to the edge of a computer monitor.
customer_reviews.author: GTS

customer_reviews.title: Cool little mirrors that help out with blind spots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mirrors to add to my new-to-me vehicle. The mirrors help me see in my blind spots and don't take up a lot of space from the main mirror. They're adjustable and so far have been adhering to the glass on my mirrors just fine. Overall, I've been very happy with these small inexpensive mirrors and they will help make me a safer driver.
customer_reviews.author: Reviews and Suggestions

customer_reviews.title: It definitely serves it purpose
customer_reviews.text: It definitely serves it purpose. It helps the driver with the blind spot that side rear mirrors have in cars. I am those fast kinda drivers (yes I cast for Fast and Furios) and I tend to change lanes quickly so I need to have a wide view to avoid any kind of accident or collision. So far I like this stuff and I live in a very hot weather and have washed the car weekly and they haven't fall.
customer_reviews.author: Jorg

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted these on upper inside corners of Jeep JLU mirrors. As outside corners would show part of mirror housing. Work great for blind spots. Adhesive has held up for a few weeks now in the hot Midwest sun. Don’t understand why Jeep doesn’t include a dual type mirror with the towing package..
customer_reviews.author: FlyinB

customer_reviews.title: Installation was fairly easy with the only difficult part was squeezing my fingers ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had these installed on my wife's '17 Forester for almost 5 months now....and they are still on there despite the weekly trips to the car washes (including the ones with brushes). Although they sometimes need to be repositioned after going thru a brush type of car wash. They do the job and do assist in eliminating the blind spots. Installation was fairly easy with the only difficult part was squeezing my fingers between the mirror and it's mounting post to firmly press against the car's mirror. Just make sure you thoroughly clean the car's mirror before installing and they should stay on just fine (contrary to some of the other reviewers). definitely would order again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Warbirds

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: While it may be hard to see from the photo I took, I can see much more than before with these mirrors. From the photo I can see a light post and a tree, that I cannot see with my regular side mirrow view. While hauling a horse trailer with my F250 these little dinky mirrors are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Dunlop

customer_reviews.title: Don’t like the swivel
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t like the swivel, I ordered them because some said they installed without swivel. But these came installed with them. I put them on but hate how it looks. So going to pull them off .
customer_reviews.author: Evelin L.

customer_reviews.title: Good View
customer_reviews.text: Right now, the weather is not distinctly cold or stormy, so I would not know how to rate the product if it has not endured drastic environmental mishaps. It sticks fast onto the side mirror and tilts easily so I may see the blind area of the LEFT backside.
customer_reviews.author: Cirrus

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works really well but the adhesive is not strong enough. One mirror fell off within 1 day. I reordered the same ones to get a matching set. UPDATE 02/28/17: Customer service, upon reading my review, contacted me and sent me an extra pair of mirrors. This was greatly appreciated and I have not had any issues with the second set that I purchased. I would definitely purchase them again. I'll keep this extra set for my other car. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jacks

customer_reviews.title: Happy with them
customer_reviews.text: I put them on the mirrors last summer and the are still doing GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: ElectronicsNut

customer_reviews.title: Easy to bump out of place but offers a wide range of sight
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot! The edgeless design and full ajustability makes for a wider range of sight which is especially helpful if you drive a big SUV (like I do) or have shoulder/neck issues (like I do). However, if you accidentally bump against one while washing your car or something, it will move and you’ll have to readjust it. It’s a little annoying but worth it to someone like me who experiences pain while turning around to check my blind spots.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Extra help for street parking and for blind spot while driving.
customer_reviews.text: Extra help for street parking and for blind spot while driving. If you have never used to it, it will be uncomfortable at the beginning but then you’ll get used to it and will appreciate the extra help that these provide while you drive. If you drive in a city where you need to park in tight spots I’ll definitely suggest you to get this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amauris Martinez

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for my car, I have a huge blind spot and this helps alot. It's feels like it's not made of glass but who cares so long is it clearling up my blind spot. It stick right on the mirror with a double sided tape that pre applied and its holding up great. It comes with 2 different fitments options to apply, a adjustable fitment and the on I use a fixed in place fitment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Took less than 5 minutes to install. You have to adjust the mirror while driving form optimum coverage of the blind spot. Took me a while to get used to the fact that there is something on my side mirrors. But it does covers the blind spot well, when I don't see the car in my side view mirror, it was completely visible in the small mirror. Spot on. I bought another pair for my daughter's car as well.
customer_reviews.author: Geeva

customer_reviews.title: Horrible adhesive. Fails quickly
customer_reviews.text: Super simple install but the adhesive is pure garbage. Lost one within the first week and now the second one is gone too. I am very certain to clean all surfaces with isopropyl before install and still this happened. Skip these
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should.
customer_reviews.text: So far they’ve been great! Bought them for my wife’s car. She loves having the extra mirror view. Installation was super quick and easy. She installed them herself and had no issues, not that she’s incompetent, but she usually wants me to do anything car related or garage or yard or well anyways the mirrors are good.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Smith

customer_reviews.title: I do like that I can swivel the mirror around
customer_reviews.text: So far, these blind spot mirrors do exactly as described. I was worried about the mirrors falling off due to other reviewers' concerns but I have not had that problem. I do like that I can swivel the mirror around. I do wish that the mirrors were a bit bigger because sometimes I have to stare at the mirror a little too long to see if there's anything in my blind spot. Other than that, this mirror does its job. I have my mirrors stuck in the bottom outer corners of my mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: tnguyen

customer_reviews.title: These are wonderful !
customer_reviews.text: Alright so this is my first time ever ordering blind-spot mirrors since I finally have my own car. I must say these have come in handy especially when parking and cars coming by me. I read the instructions and made sure my mirrors were clean before putting these on. Now I will say they haven’t came off yet or anything even when it rained these babies stayed on. I will take a picture soon but overall I’m happy with these! Easy to clean and adjust 🖤
customer_reviews.author: Kaylah

customer_reviews.title: keep looking for a better product
customer_reviews.text: The reason that I am returning this is because they are flimsy with poor construction and quality of materials. True the lightning deal was less than regular price, but still not worth it. My advice would be to go to an auto parts brick and mortar store where you are able to see what you aare buying. You might spend more but would be more satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NOLAphotoladyTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with these.
customer_reviews.text: After several months the adhesion is still strong. The fact that they're set up on a little swiveling pedestal makes them easy to adjust, which is indispensible for getting them in just the right position. I feel much more confident about driving with these little mirrors in place. Very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: These did the trick for me in removing "blind spots" on my 1956 and 1974 Porsches that have side view mirrors like compacts. Stability is good but cannot comment on sun/weather resistance as it is early days yet. Great clarity of mirror image like you find in cheaper examples.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Works great and fits great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I love these because of the many options to mount them for optimal view of blind spots. I chose to mount them flat on my rearview mirrors. What sold me is the rimless design as the bulky black or chrome borders are not the best looking and looks like it takes up a lot of space on the mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Nice mirrors
customer_reviews.text: Easy to stick on, easy to adjust, don't vibrate. These are on my Odyssey minivan and are great. I can see them clearly, even across the van on the passenger side. They are easy to stick on, and once on, they are stuck! Will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: TerryInLeesburg

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t give good visibility of blind spot
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t give me the visibility I was looking for in my blind spot. It was still hard to tell if something was there. I installed it exactly where they showed in the picture. I think it would be better if it was more curved. But it was easy to install and adjust
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Junk adhesive, and not enough
customer_reviews.text: Even after cleaning and firmly pressing what little adhesive they give you into the base, the mirror fell off after 2 days. The little swivel mount is firmly attached though, not that it matters without a mirror. Not a one star because the mirror is actually glass, albeit cheap. Glass also came scratched because there was no protector for shipping...
customer_reviews.author: Peter R

customer_reviews.title: Good with some things
customer_reviews.text: Good product/idea, but not so good packaging; one arrived cracked... weird because it was bubble wrapped, but 1 was cracked straight through the middle😞Also, the wind does slightly move it out of the position you set it on. And heavy rain with make it super foggy, so can’t really help in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila De Jesus

customer_reviews.title: They do the job well. Taking off 1 star ...
customer_reviews.text: They do the job well. Taking off 1 star because for some reason the adhesive is cut into 2 rings (inner and outer circle) but the little thing that sticks to it (they come in 2 pieces) only uses the inner circle, meaning you see the 3M-branded adhesive in the mirror. You get used to it but, why not just put only the ring that's required?
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mirror Easily Adjusted - not always a good thing
customer_reviews.text: To ensure I'd be able to cover the blind spot specific to my model car, I chose these mirrors for the adjustment ability. However, there is no way to lock the mirror into place once you've positioned it as you like so any time it gets pushed accidentally, like when washing the car, you need to re-position the mirror. Kind of a pain. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay May
